description.narrative: State and non-State institutions equipped to independently monitor child rights situation aligned with Committee on the Rights of the Child recommendations, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Government and other actors monitor child rights and contribute to evidence-based equitable State policy formulation, programming and budgeting.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: State and non-State institutions equipped to independently monitor child rights situation aligned with Committee on the Rights ofthe Child recommendations

description.narrative: The National Child Strategy and Child Action Plan were endorsed by the President. The human and technical capacity of the Office of the Ombudsperson was strengthened through adding a social worker and lawyer to the National Preventive Group team and establishing a Call Centre for the entity.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021

title.narrative: National child strategy updated, monitored and reported(52819)

target.value: 2020:National action plan for children is costed and submitted for endorsement

actual.value: 2020:Children’s Strategy and Nation Child Action Plan was endorsed by the President. Due to restrictions related to the pandemic and changed priorities of the key government partners the Action Plan could not be costed as the process required close involvement
